values:
I want to say we met on a diabetes community, but to be honest, I don't recall either...lol
     I love listening to things going on in your life.  It is never dull and I, often, find that you are saying things I wish I had the courage to say or that you seem to be in my head.  Often, I want to turn around and say, "hey, get outta my head!"  But then I realize, "hey, I'm not alone." 
     Guess that's why you get the same feelings sometimes.  Let's not forget this and continue to grow together.  
     If you ever get out to Las Vegas, we'll have to get together for some healthy nosh.  Huggles!

As I recall, we got together because of a mutual interest in Mescalero Apaches.  You are the first person I've come across who even knew what my tribe was, let alone held an interest in them.
     Although we do not comment a lot on each other's journal, I know we read and care.  This is shown by the comments that are made.  
     You roxxers my soxxers because you face your trials and tribulations and do what you can to face and scream back at them.  You may bitch and moan sometimes, but it is always with reason and, often, I find you have found a solution or a reason and look back on them to move forward.
     I am glad to name you among my friends.

1. Reply to this post if you want me to tell you how cool you are.

2. Watch my journal over the next few days for a post just about you and why you rock my socks!

3. Post these instructions in your journal and give your friends a much needed dose of love and adoration

Wow, seems like it's been a while since I properly updated with my life.  Things have been moving forward.  It feels hard a lot of the time, but that's to be expected.  It's life.  
     I've been keeping my mouth shut because I didn't want to jinx things.  J and I have been looking for a house since before October.  We have been under contract three or four times, each time, it fell through due to horrible sales agents.  I'd even gotten to the point where being under contract didn't mean that much to me anymore.  But, at the end of last month, we actually closed on a house!!!
     It was pretty much move in ready.  I picked up the keys one week, went back the next to change the locks (and take a couple boxes over) and found someone had broken in and stolen the thermostat from the wall.  The next week came back with a few more boxes and found they had come back and gone through some of my boxes.  Thankfully, I was smart and decided not to take any "good" boxes over.  So, we had our internet connection moved to the house the next day and J moved in.  So, while I packed up the condo, he was living there with no a/c for two weeks unpacking what I brought and living with no fridge or a/c.  But, he made it.
     Friday, the movers came and moved the big items and I went with.  We have "officially" moved in and replaced the thermostat so there is now a/c.  We've spent the weekend unpacking and still have the old place to go back for a few more things and clean.
     Since January, I've been working for Sprint in their call center.  I have been trained in four three areas, have worked in two and am preparing to move to a third!  I say, the more I can learn about the company, the more valuable I can become to them. 
     I've ended a friendship with someone who wasn't much of a friend.  They were a great person to party with, but anything deeper than that...simply not the type.  And I don't need drama in my life.
     Due to circumstances beyond my control, I seem to have lost or have a great separation growing between another friend.  I won't go into detail with this, but suffice to say, had I known what I know now, things would have been different and I apologize with all my heart that I did not.
     But, I seem to have replaced that one with a couple new ones who are more open to a deeper friendship.  So, I am happy and content at the moment and learning to move forward instead of deperately holding onto the past hoping it would make me happy.
     Thanks to faire visits and facebook, I've had the opportunity these last months to re-connect with old friends from before married life and from high school.  I've gotten to spend valuable time hanging out in ways I haven't before that were simply marvelous and which I look forward to getting to do again in the future.  
     Because of my new job, I have medical insurance and have begun to take better care of myself.  I am on new meds for controlling my diabetes.  This has meant better sugar levels and less injections.  If anythng, I've been combatting lows.  
     Unfortunately, as always, when I get into something I jump head first and got really sick because of it.  Two weeks ago, I went to get checked for a sore throat and ended up being placed on two bags of iv for dehydration.  I was also given meds to fight a throat infection (non-strep), a sinus infection and bronchitis.  Whoo hoo for days off from work.  Boo for having to pack and move during a time the doc wanted me on bed rest...lol  Such was life, but I'm much better at the moment. 
     So, there you have it in a bucket.  Lots going on, but overall a much happier me.  Love you all and hope all is well.

Last weekend, I was driving to faire with someone I thought was a true friend. On the way into faire, I mentioned how good it was to be back home. This person turns to me and says, "You really are more of a rennie than you are a burner." What? The one has nothing to do with the other. They are both a part of my life and I feel they are both part of who I am. I am not more one than the other.

Over the last week, I have been thinking about this statement due to many of this person's actions. Does being more of a burner mean I am allowed to have no respect for other people's time constraints and life commitments? Does being more of a burner mean I can act selfishly and expect others to commiserate with me when things do not happen to make me happy or when others get upset because of it? Does being more of a burner mean I can act like a 5 yr old? I don't believe so, because I have many other "burner" friends who don't act this way. However, I do know that this is not a person who deserves to be called my friend.

 

     It's sort of funny because my husband always gets on me about how unforgiving I am, how I am always quick to hold a grudge against those who make minor infractions that I feel have wronged me, yet I will defend to a fault anyone who makes a good first impression upon me, no matter how bad they can really be.  And, for the first time, I can really see this.  Because I did so for this person.

      Last October, I invited this person to come work with me at a booth at the LV ren faire.  I am able to work out arrangements with friends to make sure we can camp onsite as this is part of the whole experience.  This person asks me to see if I can stay on site until Monday morning.  I tell her I need to be home early to be able to wash up and such before work as I had a student at 1pm. Not a problem they say.

 

 

     This person had a problem with their vehicle and I suggested they take the vehicle to my mechanic; which they did.  This person tells me she can't pick it up until Monday morning.  Ok, still not a problem, just make sure there is a ride available and pick it up early because I have work at one.  Still told, not going to be a problem.

 

 

     Come Monday morning, she and her new bf, were still sleeping the first couple of times I checked on them.  A bit later, they were missing from their tent.  When I spoke with campmates, they stated the two said they were off looking for me and pointed the direction they had headed, which was the opposite way from the direction they knew I had been the night before.  I didn't see them again until nearly 10-11 o'clock.  When I asked what was going on with the car was told they were working on the car issue and had a ride but had to tear the person's booth down before they could leave, but don't worry, I'll be home in time.  Now, I live about 20 minutes from site and my student was about 20-30 minutes from my home.  About 11:30, my husband calls to find out how much longer before I can get home for work (mind you, at this time, he was also the coordinator for my company.).  He states he will come get me because it is starting to get close and he wanted to make sure I was on time to work.  I am also panicking because I have been after this person about the time constantly being told not to worry it was going to be okay.  About 5 minutes before my husband pulls up to site, this person finally leaves to go get the vehicle.  And, to me, just couldn't grasp why I was so upset about possibly being late to work!

 

 

     But, I defended this person time and again to my husband who just didn't want to let me go on trips dependant on this person because they seemed to have no respect for my time contraints.  I thought this person was my friend and I would defend this person to the end.  I understood they were more spontaneous than I can be.  Not a problem to me, yet.

 

 

     This season for ren faire, I ask this person if they would like to join me in working big faire, something I knew they had been a part of and seemed to want to enjoy again.  I stated they could probably work 8 hours per day since that is what I did last year and it was minimum wage plus tips, however my tips last year sucked.  Also, stated that the booth provided us with lunches, some dinner and breakfast.  Stated I would try to contact my boss there and work it out.  This person agreed to work.  Over the next few weeks, there were questions and issues about dates since there was a weekend committed to an event in LV, so I tried to contact this person.  I called, left messages, spoke to one of this person's bf's stating I really needed to hear from this person and was told the message would be passed on, sent text messages and emails.  I never heard back for near a month or so after the start of my first messages.  The reasons given, they had a relationship issue they had to think about.  Now, I really needed some confirmations because faire was coming up and if they were going to change their mind on me, I needed to make other arrangements to get to faire since so few people I know live here and drive in to L.A. for it.  Ok, I dealt with it.  Things seemed to get worked out.

 

 

     Last weekend on the way to faire, we pull over halfway there to fill up.  I really don't have the money.  I think I had like 18 dollars on me.  Ok, part my fault, we didn't clarify the arrangements on splitting the gas money.  I knew I was going to, just had expected that I would pay when I received pay on Sunday night.  Not the case, was told this person only had like 20-40 dollars for food and had planned on me paying for the tank here, where gas was 40 cents more per gallon than in town.  Must use premium in this car.  Ok, well, don't really have the money, but I'll try to put it on my debit card.  done.

 

 

     Now, this person is trying to deal with some personal issues and our planned hosts for the weekend were going to attend an adult party on Sat.  When I mentioned this to my driving host, they mentioned they really didn't want to attend so I agreed to make arrangements for us to stay at my father's.  Now, my father was going to bring some insulin to me at faire on Saturday when he was attending with a friend, since we use the same kind and I really can't afford it even with my insurance, and I would have to keep it on ice at faire.  However, when I made the arrangements for us to stay at his home on Sunday, made arrangements for me to just take it on Sunday, thus requiring less time to be kept merely on ice.  I mentioned this to this person.  As we were arriving at our Friday night's host home, they informed me that their event had been cancelled.  My "friend" says, ok, let's just stay here that way I don't have to pack everything up to go to your dad's.  now, I packed one small bag and my hoop for the trip because I know I was staying at people's and didn't want to carry to much and be burdened.  This person packs the entire house and then some.  I remind them that I have already made arrangements with my dad who was intending for us to have dinner with him as well.  They made do, especially since our host's had us pull our faire stuff out and pack everything back into the vehicle before anything else.

 

 

     We go to faire on Sat where my booth has added an extra person and is trying to make smaller shifts, presumably because the girls who worked with me last year did not handle the shifts very well.  Ok, doesn't seem to be a problem.  We settle in to work. 

 

 

     I should mention that the Monday before faire, I was put on new medications to deal with my diabetes, including a weight loss med because the doc wants me to lose weight.  The medication is an amphetamine, so it causes my body to constantly tremble, especially during that first week on it.  So, my body is pretty frackkin' tired by the end of my day.  During the week, I am usually in bed by 8 since I wake at 3:30-4:00 am for work.  So, you can imagine how early my day usually ends...lol

 

 

     Now, during this first day at faire, I tried to get exercise by walking the entire faire from back to front, then back again.  Having opened my booth and working until 2:30, then returning at 6:30 to close it down since I am the only returning person.  By the end of the day, I'm pretty frackkin' tired and starting to hurt since this is the first real exercise I have done while on these meds.  This friend comes up to the main booth wearing their new "faire bf's jacket" stating that we should just stay onsite tonight since he wanted this friend to stay with him tonight.  I state that I am really tired, really hurting, we had prior arrangements at my dad's (about 15 minutes away) and I had no bedding to camp onsite since we hadn't planned for it.  Mentioned I have no problem staying onsite, but needed to know ahead so I could make arrangements for it.  They seemed a bit pouty, but said ok, they needed to return the jacket to the bf.  We ate dinner provided by the booth. It is already late, dark and getting cold and I have no cloak or nightwear since we hadn't made plans to stay onsite late.  It's about 8/8:15 or so, by my recollection.  This person goes off to return the jacket.  I sit and wait with a couple people, who after a bit, ask me how long was I waiting, wasn't I getting cold, hadn't I mentioned I wasn't feeling well, etc.  All of which was yes.  They left and another person came up.  She and I talked for about 20 minutes before she needs to take off.  So, I sit there for a bit in the dark by myself since everyone else had wondered off for the night.  I try calling this person, but their phone is in my basket with the rest of their belongings.  Great!  I look at my phone and it is already 9:38 and they haven't come back yet.  Finally they come back saying how cute it was, the bf didn't want to let them go, kept pulling them back for kiss after goodbye kiss.  (Um, gee, thanks.  You knew I wasn't feeling well and didn't have warm clothing and kisses were more important.)  Thank goodness someone had left their cloak and it helped a little, it was open on the sides.

 

 

     The next morning, my father gives us money to get coffee and outmeal at Starbucks.  We get to faire and they take off to go see the bf.  When they come back, breakfast had already been served, but I had saved a serving for them, just to make sure they had enough for breakfast.  We set off for our respective shifts and such.  This friend comes up and states they were told they needed something to wear specific to be allowed to sit in the bf's guildyard.  As a result, they go and spend $150.00 on a new faire piece so they can sit in the guildyard.  Thought you didn't have money for gas??  whatever. 

 

 

     Now, we get to the end of the day.  Pay is lesser than I remember because the shifts have gotten a little bit shorter.  Ok, deal with it, because being at faire is the main reason I do this.  I now have my basket full of my items since dad bought me a new one.  I'm still trying to minimize my items because of how tired I am and how sore my muscles are from my meds and I have my box with the insulin and ice packs in it to carry to the vehicle out in left field.  This friend starts putting their various items in my basket saying they had to carry their clothing (remember, they had a new outfit and had to carry the items they came in.).  I mention I couldn't carry all of this.  (If you wanted to put your stuff into a basket for easier carrying, why didn't you get one?  They were only about 20-30 dollars depending on which one you got!)  So, they finally grab my small insulin box and their clothing, but the rest of their stuff goes into my basket for me to carry to the car.  Thanks. 

 

 

On the way to the car, they start complaining about how little they got paid (looks like some hours might have been missed d/t this person having to write their hours in different places).  They didn't check the money when they were with the bosses and didn't mention it before we walked out of site.  I say just mention it and have them recheck.  They get upset and say , "You told me we were probably getting 8 hours a day.  I only got 5!"  (Ok, probably, not Will. No promise I can see.)  And the tips suck. (Um, i mentioned this in the beginning before you agreed).  This doesn't cover my gas.  It takes me three tanks to make the round trip. (I paid for at least one!) and on and on it goes.  I finally give them $40.00 more.  "What's this for???" (to shut you up so I can try to sleep, you know, part of our arrangement of my driving on Friday, where I let you sleep with no interruption, and you drive home on Sundays so I can sleep since I have to be up at 3:30-4am and it is already 8:30?)  Now, I only had made about 30 dollars more than they did since I got the extra open/close hours for being the one returning member.  They continue to go on and on about how they don't think they can continue to do faire unless they get at least 8 hours.  This doesn't cover all three tanks or food. (Again, I paid for one tank so far, just gave you enough to cover a little over the second and you got free lunch both days, free dinner Sat and Free Breakfast Sunday.  You didn't pay for food.)  I say, then mention to them you need a few more hours, there is another booth to work. They are reasonable.  We leave Irwindale at about 8:20pm and finally get home to LV after 1:30am.  They mention it will be their mother's birthday next weekend and she wants them to go to D-land on Monday.

 

 

     Monday, I find out that that tank of gas I had to put on my card had overdrafter, I don't have enough money to cover it because I was now short because of the extra money I had given the friend the night before.  As a result of my bank overage, they also manage to overdraft my savings acct, not really sure how and still trying to work it out.  So, in all, this weekends trip has now cost me about $140.00 in travel expenses. ($28.00 for the tank, 2 overdraft charges of $35.00, an add. day overdraft fee of $5.00 since I couldn't get to the bank until they started processing under the next day, plus the additional $40.00 due to the bitching).   I now have $20.00 left until next weekend.

 

 

     Tuesday, I get a text about 4:30 stating they will call me when they get home.  By the time I go to bed at 8, I know they have been home for a while since both facebook and LJ have a plethora of meme's up.  No call.  I get a call after 8:15, just as I was drifting off to sleep.  The friend is calling to say it is their mother's b-day this weekend and they are going to go to D-land with them on Monday and can't drive me home Sunday.  They say, I can drop my car off with you and you can drive down.  Mention to them I wasn't sure I would have the money for gas to get down there since that one tank had cost me over $100.00 in fees.  Their response, "oh. let me know."  I work to find another ride, am told I could be squeezed in one place, but it would be tight.  Ok, I'll trade in some of my collector's chips and get the gas money.  Ok, I'll go ahead and use your car.  (Meaning I don't get to sleep on Sunday either and have to drive home after working a day at faire.) 

 

 

     Again, I will accept partial fault for the next issue since I "assumed" they were being followed by their mother into town (they live an hour outside of LV.) and were dropping the car off (Their words) and riding into L.A. with mom.  (again, they stated, they were riding to L.A. with mom and could leave me their car.)

 

 

     They ask me when I would be available for them to drop off the car on Thursday.  I say anytime between 3pm and 8pm since I have to be in bed by then for work the next day.  I get a text about 4:30 saying they are off in about an hour and will head my way.  Now, I didn't sleep very well the other night and by 5pm, was fighting to stay awake.  My meds make me exhausted because of the upper effects and I had been up since before 3am.  I don't get the first call until about 7-7:15pm saying they were stuck on the other side of Hoover dam, traffic was stop and go, they will call me again to let me know they are on the other side.  I get another call about 7:30-7:45 telling me they are on the other side and on their way...

 

 

     "You are ready to drive me home, right?"  What??  You didn't mention I needed to drive you home.  I really can't.  I am really tired and didn't plan for this.  (it would be at least a two hour drive both ways, in the dark, to and from a place I have only been once or twice off a road that has no street lights for a long portion of the way.)  "How the fuck did you think I was getting home?  I told you I had a meeting in the morning!" (now raising their voice at me) Please don't yell at me.  You didn't mention this..."Yes, I did. yes, I did, Yes, I did, Yes, I did. (over and over like a 5 yr old.) "How the hell did you think I was getting home???" Stop yelling, you said you were going to L.A. with your mother and leaving me your car..."I told you that you had to drive me home" (Now really screaming at me)  I tell this person to stop screaming at me, they don't, I hang up.

 

 

     They call me back about 5-10 minutes later, I am in bed, body shaking and tired.  "So, are you driving me home?"  I can, if you want me to get into an accident.  I really cannot drive right now. "Then, I'm going to turn around and go home." Ok.  *click*  I hung up.

 

 

     What was I supposed to do?  My body was literally shaking from exhaustion.  If I drove, I know I would have gotten into an accident, either because I couldn't drive straight or because I would have fallen asleep behind the wheel.  They never mentioned that I would need to drive them home or I would have taken a nap instead of waiting up for them to arrive.  I had sent a text asking if mom was following them into town, since I realized, a bit too late in retrospect, that I didn't know if that was truly the plan and had gotten no response.  Unfortunately, they often don't return calls, text or voice messages, or emails, so nothing really new there. 

 

 

     End result, I was unable to connect with the other LV driver and get a ride.  I had to call my boss at faire and apologize for letting him down, but I couldn't get to L.A.  He asked, "Aren't you riding with so-n-so?" as this was the pre-arranged commitment since at least a month before faire started.  So, I had to give him a short story version and explain I was trying to get another ride, but hadn't heard back and greyhound was cost prohibitive.  I have never fallen back on a commitment like this!

 

 

     So, is this what being a burner means?  Having no respect for other's time contraints or health issues?  Expecting other's to read my mind?  Expecting other's to do what I say, even if I change or add arrangements at the last minute with no thought about how it affects the other person? 

 

 

     I am sorry this person drove most of the way into town before finding out I couldn't drive them home as they thought I would.  I am sorry I didn't ask before hand to make sure what I thought I understood was correct.  But, I am not sorry for endangering them or myself by taking their car and driving when I knew I was in no condition to.  I am sorry for hanging up on you, it was rude, and my getting tired of you screaming at me like a child is no excuse.  And I am sorry if I'm not the "burner" you think I should be to be able to claim such a title. 

 

     But, I am not sorry for figuring out that you have only your best interests in mind.  I am not sorry for finding out that you really aren't the type of person I want to call a close friend.  I am not sorry for deciding to take you out of my close circle of friends.  And I am not going to be sorry for calling myself a burner and feeling a part of the burner community, because I do not believe this is what a burner really is. 



A burner or a rennie are names we give ourselves and each other to remind ourselves that we are parts of these wonderful communities. I do not believe that one must have THIS MUCH FEELING one way or the other towards any community to be able to state they are one because they feel a part of that community.

You do not get to tell me what I am more or less of because I do not fit into your perception of what it means to be one.

I am Brandi. I am Guinethe. I am Chewtoy. I am multi-cultural. I am Ren folk. I am a Burner. I am.
Why is it repeatedly asking me ti verify I am of legal age???  When I click yes I am, it takes me back to the verify legal age page instead of my friends page which I had no trouble with yesterday!!

"Aw..This was neat. I was happy to get to be invited to participate in this.  And, uh, for one, you need a little bit of levity in this job. Especially with, uh, so much that has gone on in the last couple of months that has been so, um, political, obviously..."

Ok, so she was promoting a local business as well, but a turkey farm/slaughterhouse right before Thanksgiving, No, thank you!

My dad called this morning.  He is a Vietnam Vet.  He served '67 to '69.  He was sent in to help rescue hostages at the Embassy during the Tet Offensive.  He is 1 of 17 survivors from the assault on Nui Bah Dinh, the Black Virgin Mountain.

He called not to relate these stories I have grown up with, but to talk to me about Henry Lee Bradshaw.  A man he called friend, a man he lost in 'Nam.

A couple of years ago, I got my father a book about Vietnam.  He has always read them and I didn't think he had that book.  Inside was a letter written by a man.  

This man wrote about how it had been his birthday and he had gotten drunk to celebrate.  Henry Lee offered to take his watch since it was his birthday.  That night, they were assaulted.  (note: My father was stationed on the next mountain over at this time.)  Henry Lee was killed.

A couple of years ago, he went to visit the Long beach Vietnam Memorial in California.


Here he came across Henry Lee's name again.  Henry Lee was from Long Beach, CA.

This morning, while flipping through channels, he came across a show about the Vietnam Memorial wall in Washington, D.C.  They were talking about items left behind at the wall.  As they mentioned (he let me listen to the recording) how items were either left behind, intentionally or accidentally, like letters and the bullet that had killed Henry Lee Bradshaw on August 12, 1968.

My dad cannot get over how Henry Lee keeps popping up in his life.  He plans on getting dog tags made with Henry Lee's name on it and attaching it to his motorcycle that he rides as a proud member of the Viet Nam Veteran's Motorcycle Club, Chapter P, out of Pasadena, CA.

I love you, daddy and all of your brothers, alive and fallen.

I am now 2 months cigarette free and 1 and a half weeks soda free! 

I am still waiting on the gas issue to be resolved with the new home.  In-laws have looked at it and aren't appalled at it...lol

Man, I didn't have the cravings my hubby did for the smokes or soda in the beginning (not that he gave up sodas.), but, boy are they rearing their respective heads now!

Send me strength, please?

hee hee

Yesterday, I was at the library with one of my students, a 9 yr old girl.  As we walked in, to our left, the room was bustling like she had never seen.  She turns to me and asks, "What's going on in there?"

I turn to her and ask, "Do you really want to know?  Let's go in."

It was the early voting poll the day before they were moving elsewhere.  I was already planning on voting, but this was the perfect opportunity to teach her something not in her books yet.

We walk in and I explain this is where everyone is voting for people in government, judges, district people who helped take care of local things and our nation's next president.

She turns to me and says, "You are voting for Obama, right???"

I say, "Of course, I am.  I was a delegate for Obama at our state Democratic convention."

We walk up to one of the people checking id's and they inform me that she can go right to the poll with me since she is under 18.  Great!  Terrific! 

She ended up going thru the process with me.  She double, no triple-checked that I had voted for Obama.  That was really cute.  When we were done and had submitted my vote, we returned my e-card to the lady at the door who gave both of us an "I voted" sticker, which we both wore proudly the rest of the evening. 

Another of my students on Monday asked me who I was voting for.  When I told him, he said, "good". 

When I asked if his entire family was voting for Obama, he responded, "No, they are all voting for McCain, but everyone at my work is voting for Obama.  Except for one person.  But, I want to vote for Obama.  It's a good thing you are voting for Obama."

This from an 8yr old boy.

I love seeing my kids want to learn and be a part of things.

J signed the first contract paperwork this morning.  We are awaiting a call back from the mortgage lender to make an appointment to sign the loan paperwork.  At this rate, we are looking to be in place by mid-December~

I should probably clarify my statement.

We got approved on our offer.  We still have to apply for the loan, get the inspection done and sign final paperwork.  However, the first step is a huge one, in my opinion!

Thanks for the congrats and such!

Huggles!

We got the house!!!!

The one we really wanted!!!!

If just five people from this viewing post this and five more from those, we can reach so many. 

So..  Don't vote.

Unless you care,

If you're on my friends list, I want to know 36 things about you. I don't care if we never talk, or if we already know everything about each other. Short and sweet is fine... you're on my list, so I want to know you better!

Comment here and repost a blank one on your own journal.



01) Are you currently in a serious relationship?
02) What was your dream growing up?
03) What talent do you wish you had?
04) If I bought you a drink what would it be?
05) Favorite vegetable?
06) What was the last book you read?
07) What zodiac sign are you?
08) Any Tattoos and/or Piercings? Explain where.
09) Worst Habit?
10) If you saw me walking down the street would you offer me a ride?
11) What is your favorite sport?
12) Do you have a Pessimistic or Optimistic attitude?
13) What would you do if you were stuck in an elevator with me?
14) Worst thing to ever happen to you?
15) Tell me one weird fact about you.
16) Do you have any pets?
17) What if I showed up at your house unexpectedly?
18) What was your first impression of me?
19) Do you think clowns are cute or scary?
20) If you could change one thing about how you look, what would it be?
21) Would you be my crime partner or my conscience?
22) What color eyes do you have?

Sometimes, when working with a child who just fights learning or seems to now be picking up things, I get discouraged about tutoring.  You know, am I doing any good, am I wasting their time, etc.  This morning, I got a call that reminded me why I do this.

The mother of a  student I started working with in January, who has moved out of state, just called me.  She called to tell me her daughter was a "genius" (lol) thanks to me.  Apparently, her daughter who had trouble with her weekly spelling tests, with her mother going through the words with her every day, etc...  and was failing them, is now acing them without the run throughs with her mother.  Her vocabulary has improved.

Ex.  This morning, passing a statue of a dog, her step-father asked why the dog was allowed to be free without a leash.  Her response, "Because he's a sculpture!"  When asked if she knew what a sculpture was, she told him it was a piece of art. 

She is a fourth grader and I am so proud of her.  I just sent her an email.  I can't wait to hear from her. 

This is why I do it.

First, living arrangements have changed, for the much better.

The hubby and I are looking for a house to purchase.  We are being offered a great help from the in-laws and have found that our credit is not anywhere as bad as we had thought.  We have already put an offer on a 2 story home, but it is a short sale and that could take some time for approvals.  In the meantime, we are still looking around for other homes that we may qualify for much sooner than the short sale.

I am not looking at anything with less than 3 bedrooms/1.5+ bath.  I am not looking at anything with a less than spacious or with an ajoining space for my kitchen work.  I am not looking at anything with mold residue.  Yes, I can afford to be picky.

Have made some great new friends this year.  Have made some acquaintances better friends.  Have given up friendships with some.  Am currently worried about some friends.

Am keeping better track of blood sugars.  Am taking my morning shots.  Am taking my sliding scale shots and attempting for the first time to count carbs and bolus accordingly.  Unfortunately, lost a package with UPS for 5 vials of insulin and have to get those replaced, with no insurance.

Was a delegate to the state Democratic Convention for Nevada and had an adventure there.

Went camping with a great group of people this summer and can't wait for what the future has in store.

And actually had dinner and a night out with my mother without  my being frustrated at her or being lectured at by her!

Sorry, just got back from karaoke with Mom and am tired, so my thoughts are a bit jumbled at the moment.

Oh. and made a great new friend, thanks to others, who enjoys karaoke and seems to share a like mind with me.  It shall be interesting to see where this will take me!  See ya on the flip side!!

I got a call this morning from my uncle. He said my great-aunt was in Ca and her daughter had taken her to Stateline last night. I just got a bulletin about the passing of a friend.  Some may say we weren't much of friends because we hadn't had much contact the last couple of years; I had only known her from my short lived career as a submissive in L.A.  But, we shared an afternoon that cannot ever be relived.

Sassy and I would talk during our shifts since I rarely had a session and hers were sporadic.  We found out that my first "Real" Sir was an old friend of hers.  We shared some thoughts and she found out that I was his when he passed.  That created a bond between us. 

Shortly after that, the one year anniversary of his passing came up.  His loss was still painful for me.  She was angry because she hadn't been able to be around; hadn't been able to say good bye.  So, she agreed to go with me to spend the afternoon with him.

I picked her up, we stopped by the liquor store and bought the makings of Snake bites and a pack of his cigarettes.  We pulled up to his grave and cleaned up his headstone with the sponges we had brought with us.  And we sat there, drinking and smoking, talking, laughing and crying.  Sharing stories about him and about ourselves.  She was one of the few people back then that I didn't feel I had to "be" someone with.  I was just myself that day. 

I am saddened by the news of her passing.  We had just reconnected.  Having added each other on YIM, I had been waiting for the day we would be online at the same time and could have a chat.  The other day, her Wife posted a bulletin about her being in the hospital and being able to send an email that they would print out for her.  I sent her one.  I couldn't wait to hear the good news of the little girl they were having and being able to talk to her online about everything and to catch up.

I can't do that.  She is gone.  She passed away giving birth to T/their daughter.  I will never be able to give her a hug or say good bye.  I will never be able to tell her how happy I was that she was working a good job, had gotten her license, had had a beautiful baby girl.  I am sad.  I am angry.  I wish I had gotten to know her better than I had.  I miss her.  She was always real with me.

About  a year ago, I went into the pet store to help my former supervisor with her volunteer group, F.L.O.C.K. (For the Love Of Cats and Kittens).  When I got there, I found out the group was no longer at that location.  However, Best Friends, another rescue group, was there.  I had no ride until my husband was done working with a student so I made myself comfy and helped out.

The in-house veterinarians brought out this tiny ball of darkness.  They hadned her to me to hold and this baby kitten fell asleep in my arms.  They told me her story.  

She had been abandoned in a shopping cart and placed in a far corner of the store.  She had a neuro-muscular disorder that caused her front paw to be turned inward and be useless.  The vet said they had given her a full examination and that was the only thing wrong with her.  She needed a home because no one else could take her and they had had her for a week already.  I got the okay and we took her home that day.

From the beginning, she has always been a ball of energy.  Rushing here and there.  Jumping from one thing to another.  Never really stopping.  She will come to me when she wants to be held on the rare occasion, but she is a daddy's girl.  If I try to pick her up, she just sits there for a split moment before jumping away.  

Well, tonight I was saying good night to a friend online who always gives me the sappiest good nights.  So I decided to give her one in return.  I pulled up the words to a tune that was a favorite wav of mine way back when.  It is called the Cuppycake song.  Here it is...

You're my Honeybunch, Sugarplum
Pumpy-umpy-umpkin, You're my Sweetie Pie
You're my Cuppycake, Gumdrop
Snoogums-Boogums, You're the Apple of my Eye
And I love you so and I want you to know
That I'll always be right here
And I love to sing sweet songs to you
Because you are so dear










 


Well, my little ball of energy mewed at me when I sang it to my friend.  A little bit later, my husband had it stuck in his head and was trying to sing it.  He didn't know the words, so I pulled them up again and started to sing them aloud.  Again, Indy mewed.  But, this time, she jumped up on my desk and crawled into my arms.  I continued to sing the song as if in a loop to her.  She just laid back in my arms and started to purr.  I must have sat there for over 5 minutes with her in my arms, singing this little tune to her, purring away contentedly, as never before...

I can't tell you how sweet a feeling that has come over me right now.  As sick as I am and I feel like I am on top of the world...

Good night all...

So, live has a twisted humor.  I survived not getting my hubby's really bad cold, before leaving for my trip to Los Angeles and Mexico, only to return with it just as horribly as he had!

Anyway, I had a fabulous time during my short vacation.  Much fun and baudiness ensued.  To say the least.  Nw friends, sand, dancing, older friends, BIG TENT, Langostas, policia, tans ...yeah, much fun was had...

I've been in bed the past three days since I've been home though.  Way to sick and now my lungs hurt from the coughing.  But, today seems a little better.  talk to you soon!

So, it's been a little bit since I posted about my decision about GB.  There are a couple of reasons. 

First.  I am currently waiting for the new insurance my boss has decided to pay for me to get.  However, according to the paperwork, they do not pay for the Lapband, so if I were to get anything done, it would have to be the Gastric and only after a 12 month intensive program, which I am thoroughly prepared to go thru.

Second.  I just weighed in this morning and am down to 212.  That is down about 10-13 pounds since my trip to Los Angeles at the end of March.  When I left for L.A., I was at 224/225!  If I keep it up, I may not need gastric!  Woot

So, I will keep you all updated on things...

Since I am totally hoping for feedback in this decision I am making for myself, I wanted to share a video clip I found that describes the lapband.

http://www.lapbandtalk.com/lap_band_video_clip.swf

This is the other type of WLS (weight loss surgery) that is being considered.

http://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/Gastric-bypass

Personally, I am leaning towards the lapband.  Of course, I will not make a final decision until I get to see a doctor about my decisions.  

I am concerned about the loss of nutrients that appears to be a common side effect of the gastric bypass.  I am finding the lapbanf appealing because I really want it to be a good portion of myself working harder to control myself rather than it being my stomache controlling me.  I admit that reading about "dumping" syndrome scares the hell out of me!

I know many of you have offered to talk with me.  I haven't taken you up on it because I don't really know what questions to ask yet and I guess because I am still scared.  I, also, do not want to get my hopes up high and speak with people about it personally until I get insurance and can really look into this, because there is no way, without insurance working with me, that I will be able to afford this major change in my life, financially speaking.  

Mentally, I want this.  I have wanted to lose this weight for so long.  Ok, maybe not as long as I want to think.  

I am beginning to think that I sabotaged myself many times because I felt "safe: being fat.  If I was fat, then that is why people don't want to be near me.  That it wasn't because they didn't like "who" I was, just "what" I was.  I'm done feeling that way.  

I was ripped to shreds emotionally growing up.  Now is the time to put that little girl together so she can truly grow and expand in who she is.  I don't want to be the victim anymore.  I want to live life, not just pretend to do so.

Thanks for listening to me rant so much lately!

I am sitting here watching a rerun of ER.  In it, Dr. Marc Green passes away.  I know this, I saw it years ago when it aired. 

Why am I sitting here crying my eyes out, just like I did years ago?

Why do I cry at the drop of a hat?  I see pain on tv, I know it isn't real, I know it is acting, but it still makes me cry.  I feel like such a wuss sometimes because I cry so easily at pain, even fake pain.  Grrrrrrr....I get so frustrated with myself sometimes.

This was a great weekend.  My Dad and his brothers , who can be seen here attending my wedding, were in town for their regional run.  

Friday night was meeting my dad at the Palace Station and dinner with my hubby and some brothers at the World Carnival Buffet at the Rio.  Afterwards, we walked through a couple of the shops at the Rio before heading home.

Here is the cute tea set my Dad bought me! 

And here is the beautiful Faery my hubby bought me as an 8-month wedding anniersary giftie!  Seeing as how it was Friday the 20th! 

Saturday, I spent with my Dad at the Palace Station.  His meetings were there, so I dressed the part and hung out with the bikers all day.  It was a little bit of an eventful day, with one diabetic issue (not mine), but things worked out in the end.  Finally brought Dad home about 8pm, had dinner and went to bed.

Sunday, took Dad to meet his brothers for the ride home.  It felt funny to me.  Exactly two years ago, April 22, 2005, I drove to Las Vegas with my truck full of clothing only to live in a hotel for a week until I found a place to live.  As I passed through Barstow, I saw my Dad's chapter and honked at them, saying good bye, since I was moving to Las Vegas.  

I can't believe two years has passed by.  It almost feels like it was just yesterday.  But, I don't regret a thing.  In fact, my life is so much better now than it was back then.  I certainly cannot complain.  

Look to the future, there is so much more in store!
Yay, got the internet service back!  Yippee...  I was beginning to worry about withdrawal symptoms...

So, we have been restless and been going out and playing a little bit. Well, we have gotten a little lucky. Not greatly, but a bit. As a result, He gave me permission to buy my Alma ticket tonight! All paid for!!! I am going!!!! 


Wheeeeeeeeee!!!!!!!! 

Now, if only I could get time to work with me so I didn't have to wait so long...but, that's ok. I sooooo cannot wait to see the new friends I made on my last LA trip!!! Huggles!!

So, about 2 hours ago, I find out that I have no water.  I live in a condominium, so I know our water is communal.  I went outside to see what was going on and find out that my neighbors downstairs have been flooded.  Turns out the next door neighbor to me had a water leak and it flooded them both.  He works at night and wasn't home.  The fire department had to break in his door to figure out what the problem was.

So, for the last 2 hours, me being the only person who knows all parties involved, I've been making calls to the tenant next door, the HOA management and calling the number for the actual unit owner on the number I found online for him.  Oh, and because there is no power to those flooded units for safety reasons, I have extenstion cords from my kitchen, running out the door and doesn the stairs so they can run water vacs.  Which aren't strong enough, so now there is a company we are waiting on to come so they can do their thing.  

Can you say Sunday night excitement?  And me with those cursed monthly cramps getting in my way.  Alma, take me away!

Well, here it is.  Something I have considered for a while now.  My hubby has suggested it.  Now, I have friends suggesting it.  I want it.

I figure now is a good time, since our company is talking about getting us insurance starting next month.  It will mean so much to me.  I am starting my research, in ernest, now.  What am I talking about?

I'm talking about weighing the pros and cons of the Lap-band (http://www.lapbandsolutions.com/about.html) and Gastric Bypass (http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/007199.htm).

So far, after talking with many people (none of whom are professional, though some have had gastric bypass themselves), I find myself leaning more towards the lap-band.  It seems less invasive which means a lot to me.  It states that it can be adjusted and usually the goal is a weight loss of 1-3lbs per week.  That seems just fine to me.  I would like to be able to work myself down and try to tone myself as I go as opposed to having to need a ton of plastic surgery to get rid of excess skin.  

Currently, according to a couple of the BMI calculators I have found online, my BMI is 42.4.  I am obese.  I don't want to be obese anymore.  I don't want to continue to have my husband sleep in another room because my weight may be causing sleep apnea which my previous doctors wouldn't even address because they were so concerned with my diabeted.  I would like the chance to get off of having to give myself 2-5 shots in the stomache a day to control my blood sugars.

I know this will mean a lot of changes.  I am currently in the process of making some now, before going to a doctor to talk about this because it means a lot to me.  It will, also, mean I will need a lot of support.  From outside and within myself.  I am working on the "myself" part already.  I want to live.  I want to be healthy.  I want to live life, not let it pass by me on a river of whipped cream while riding a banana split boat to death.

Thank you to those of you who have taken the time to share with me how you care about me by caring about my weight and health.  I understand I am not as alone as I have thought I was.  Soon, I will even believe it, all of the time.  8-)

I have tried diets, Weight Watchers, The Miracle Soup Diet, Counting calories, cutting my fat intake, trying to stay away from starches (boy, is this a hard one.  I've been raised on rice, practically my whole life!).  I've tried working out.  I've tried cardio.  I've had numerous gym memberships and have endure working out by myself (which I hate).  Nothing has really worked.  

My mother put me on Weight Watchers at the age of 6, when I wasn't overweight yet, because she was and if she was on it, so would I.  At 7, it was Nutrisystem.  At 8, all salads for a year.  At 9, it was the Miracle Soup Diet, non-stop for almost a year!  You do realize that diet is made to go on for 7, off for a couple days, back on?

When I moved in with my father, he fed me whatever I wanted and then some.  At 10, I was allowed to eat two full sized T-bone steaks.  I was in a survival mode at that time because of the history of food when I was living with my mother.  My father tells of finding food hidden in drawers and in my closet.  Not the typical "fat kid" hiding, either.  It wasn't candy or sweets I was hiding.  I was hiding pieces of steak, vegetables, bread... all things taken from dinner or lunch.  Apparently, I was so concerned about when I would be allowed to have food again, I was saving it for later!!  By middle school, I was already weighing in close to or over 200lbs!

The only time I can remember being under 200lbs since middle school was a time in my life I was taking speed.  Yes, I did it!  I don't ever want to do it again!  Yes, I lost weight, but what I would lose now to it is something I don't want to lose.  My friends and my life are not worth that shit.

I am through being fat.  I am through being Morbidly Obese!  I want change!!!

Thoughts???  Anyone?  Am I crazy?  I care about my friend's opinions and am willing to put myself out here for you to discuss.  Thank you.  I love you all!

X-posted to myspace and tribe for the most in getting opinions and discussion.
